about.description: A fast mobile client for intervals.icu with a focus on maps and visual analytics.
about.disclaimer: Veloq is an independent, open-source project. It is not affiliated with, endorsed by, or connected to intervals.icu in any way.
about.garminNote: Activity data may include information from Garmin, Strava, Polar, Wahoo, and other devices connected to your intervals.icu account.
about.mapAttribution: Map tiles provided by OpenStreetMap, Carto, and Stadia Maps. Map data copyright OpenStreetMap contributors.
about.title: About & Legal

activity.chartHint: Hold to scrub • Hold chip for axis

explanations.conditions: Temperature from weather data or your device sensor.
explanations.energy: Estimated energy expenditure from heart rate, power, and duration.
explanations.heartRate: Average heart rate during the activity.
explanations.trainingLoad: Training Stress Score (TSS) quantifies training load based on duration and intensity relative to your threshold.
explanations.yourForm: Your Form (TSB) on this day. This is a daily value based on your overall training, not specific to this activity. TSB = Fitness (CTL) minus Fatigue (ATL).

activityDetail.noMatchedSectionsDescription: Sections matching this activity will appear here
activityDetail.noRouteMatchDescription: Complete this route a few more times to start tracking your performance, or expand your timeline in Settings to include older activities.

alerts.clearCacheMessage: This will clear all cached activity data, activity tracks, and route matching data, then start reloading. This may take a few minutes.
alerts.clearRouteCacheMessage: This will clear all route matching data and immediately re-analyse activity tracks.
alerts.disconnectMessage: This will remove your API credentials from the app. You will need to enter them again to use the app.
alerts.failedToClear: Failed to clear cache. Please try again.
alerts.failedToDisconnect: Failed to disconnect. Please try again.
alerts.syncAllMessage: This will sync up to 10 years of activity data in the background. This enables deeper route analysis and comparison.

attribution.demoData: Demo mode uses real activity traces. Used with permission from the author.
attribution.garminTrademark: Garmin and the Garmin logo are trademarks of Garmin Ltd.

cache.noValidGpsData: No valid GPS data in fixtures

networkError.description: Check your internet connection and try again
networkError.title: Connection error

noActivities.description: Your activities will appear here once you sync with Intervals.icu
noActivities.title: No activities yet

noData.description: Complete some activities to see your stats
noData.title: No data available

noResults.description: Try adjusting your search or filters
noResults.title: No results found

errorState.defaultMessage: Failed to load data. Please try again.

fitnessScreen.fatigueDescription: is a 7-day exponentially weighted moving average of your training load.
fitnessScreen.fitnessDescription: is a 42-day exponentially weighted moving average of your training load.
fitnessScreen.formDescription: is fitness minus fatigue. Train in the
fitnessScreen.title: Fitness & Form

licenses.footer: Tap any licence badge to view the full licence text. Tap the link icon to visit the project repository.
licenses.intro: Veloq is built with open-source software. This screen lists the third-party libraries and their licences.
licenses.title: Third-Party Licences

login.apiKeyDescription: For local-only mode. Your key never leaves your device.
login.connectionFailed: Failed to connect. Please check your API key and try again.
login.createAccountHint: Create a free account to track your training.
login.disclaimer: Veloq is not affiliated with intervals.icu
login.instructions:
1. Open Intervals.icu Settings
2. Scroll to "Developer Settings"
3. Copy your API Key
login.invalidApiKey: Invalid API Key. Please check your key and try again.
login.localModeNote: Local mode: All data stays on your device
login.oauthFailed: Sign in failed. Please try again.
login.oauthNotConfigured: OAuth is not configured. Use API key login instead.
login.oauthStateValidationFailed: Security validation failed. Please try signing in again.
login.securityNote: Your credentials are stored securely on your device
login.sessionExpired: Your session has expired. Please sign in again.
login.sessionRevoked: Your access was revoked. Please sign in again.
login.subtitle: Connect to Intervals.icu
login.title: Veloq

maps.fitAllHint: Long press to fit all activities

routes.adjustSportTypeFilter: Try adjusting the sport type filter
routes.duplicateNameMessage: Please choose a different name. Each route must have a unique name.
routes.expandTimeline: Expand the timeline to analyse more activities. Route matching will continue in the background until complete.
routes.firstRunHint: Run this route again to compare your performance over time
routes.frequentSectionsInfo: Frequent sections are road sections you travel often, detected automatically from your activity tracks.
routes.potentialSectionDescription: You've used this {{sport}} path {{count}} times. Create a section to track your performance?
routes.routesWillAppear: Routes will appear after your activities are analysed
routes.routesWithTwoPlus: Routes with 2+ activities on similar paths will appear here
routes.sectionCreatedDescription: Your custom section has been created and activities have been matched
routes.sectionCreationFailed: Failed to create section. Please try again.
routes.sectionTooLarge: Section is too large. Try selecting a shorter portion.
routes.sectionTooLargeWarning: Section may be too large to save
routes.sectionTooLargeWithHint: Section is too large. Try making it at least {{reduction}} shorter.
routes.sectionsDescription: Sections are detected when you travel the same roads multiple times, even on different routes
routes.gpsTrackNotSynced: GPS data not available. Please wait for sync to complete and try again.
routes.invalidSectionRange: Invalid selection range. Please try selecting a different portion.
routes.shareDetailsWithDeveloper: Copy details and share with developer if reporting issue

routesScreen.enableInSettings: Enable route matching in Settings to automatically detect repeated routes from your activities.
routesScreen.title: Routes

sections.deleteSectionConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this section? This action cannot be undone.
sections.disableSectionConfirm: This section will be hidden from activity details. You can re-enable it later from the sections list.
sections.duplicateNameMessage: Please choose a different name. Each section must have a unique name.
sections.scrubHintScrollable: Swipe to scroll • Hold to scrub
sections.setAsReferenceConfirm:
Use this activity as the reference?

The section will be re-matched against all your activities. This may add or remove activities from this section.
sections.setReferenceError: Failed to set reference. The section or activity may have changed. Please try again.
sections.resetReferenceConfirm:
Reset to automatic reference selection?

The section will be re-matched against all your activities. This may add or remove activities from this section.

settings.cacheHint: Caches activity locations and tracks for World Map and route matching. Use the timeline to expand the date range.
settings.clearAllReloadDescription: This will clear all cached activity data, activity tracks, and route matching data, then start reloading. This may take a few minutes.
settings.clearRouteDescription: This will clear all route matching data and immediately re-analyse activity tracks.
settings.dataSourcesDescription: Activity and wellness data is synced from intervals.icu, which integrates with various fitness platforms and devices.
settings.defaultMapHint: 'Default' uses the map style set above
settings.disconnectDescription: This will remove your API credentials from the app. You will need to enter them again to use the app.
settings.metricsHint: Toggle metrics on/off and reorder them using the arrows. Only enabled metrics appear in the dashboard header.
settings.primarySportHint: Affects home screen metrics and default stats page view.
settings.primarySportHintCycling: FTP shown in feed header. Performance page shows Power Curve, power zones, eFTP trend, and decoupling.
settings.primarySportHintRunning: Threshold pace and LTHR shown in feed header. Performance page shows Pace Curve, running power, and HR zones.
settings.primarySportHintSwimming: CSS (Critical Swim Speed) shown in feed header. Performance page shows Swim Pace Curve and HR zones.
settings.routeMatchingDescription: Automatically detect repeated routes from your activities
settings.syncAllHistoryDescription: This will sync up to 10 years of activity data in the background. This enables deeper route analysis and comparison.
settings.syncInProgress: Please wait for the current sync to complete.
settings.title: Settings
settings.unitsAutoHint: Uses your device's regional settings to determine units
settings.unitsImperialHint: Distances in miles, elevation in feet, temperature in Fahrenheit
settings.unitsMetricHint: Distances in kilometres, elevation in metres, temperature in Celsius

stats.addEventsHint: Add events on intervals.icu to see them here
stats.completeActivitiesHeatmap: Complete activities to see your calendar heatmap
stats.completeActivitiesHr: Complete activities with heart rate data to see zone distribution
stats.completeActivitiesPower: Complete activities with power meter data to see zone distribution
stats.completeActivitiesYearComparison: Complete activities to see year-over-year comparison
stats.completeDecouplingHint: Complete a sustained effort with power and heart rate data to see decoupling analysis
stats.completePowerActivities: Complete power-based activities to see your FTP trend
stats.createWorkoutsHint: Create workouts on intervals.icu to see them here
stats.decouplingExplanation: Decoupling measures cardiac drift - how much your heart rate rises relative to power output during sustained efforts. Lower is better, indicating efficient aerobic energy production.

statsScreen.garminNote: Charts may include data from Garmin devices
statsScreen.title: Performance
statsScreen.paceCurveInfo: CS (critical speed) and D' are calculated using the 2 parameter model. Intervals.icu uses your best 1k, 2k, 3k, 4k and 5k times keeping those that take between 2 and 15+ minutes.
statsScreen.powerCurveInfo: Estimated FTP is calculated using power curves from FastFitness.Tips and Morton's 3 parameter critical power model. The algorithm requires just 1 max effort of between 180 seconds and 30 minutes. W' is relative to eFTP.

wellness.connectHint: Connect a wearable or log wellness data in Intervals.icu
wellness.smoothingDescription: Apply a rolling average to reduce daily noise and show trends more clearly.
wellness.smoothingHint: Auto uses optimal smoothing for the selected time range
wellness.trendHint: HRV, sleep, and resting HR trends will appear here when data is logged
